title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Needed to talk to the professor to join thier lab as a research assistant. After showing interest and a genuine desire to learn and conrtribute, most professors would be happy to have you
Interview Questions: How did you hear about my research?

title: Assistant Scientist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: First round was group interview. Each interviewer ask his or her question. Second round was the detailed question about deep learning and coding skill. The time gap between first round and second is about a week.
Interview Questions: Explain what you is your contributions from past job in detail?

title: Senior IT Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Great interview with a group of three people who quizzed me on various aspects of technical knowledge. They asked scenario based questions around how I would solve problems with software and systems. They also asked detailed software engineering related questions, too.
Interview Questions: I can't remember the questions, but they were scenario based.

title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Short interview process asking mostly customer service questions, like walking through a person who has never used a computer on how to open a browser. Whole turn around process is very quick.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position

title: Group Fitness Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Very great, she asked everything most interviewers would ask. I felt comfortable and got a call back soon. It was a two part interview where she asked me questions and I had to send in a video.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite yoga pose?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: It was easy process. I had to take general gre before. Contacting prof helped. Past research work helped. Applied through application. Heard back in 3 weeks. They also have scholarships that you might be eligible.
Interview Questions: Past research project conducted during undergrad

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Thirty minutes zoom interview. It is just an informal interview where you talk with the supervisor about your previous research experience and teaching experience. Be relaxed. It’s easy and every interviewer can make it.
Interview Questions: What is your research experience?

title: Security Guard Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Simple, thoroughly enjoyable and addictive fun enjoyable artistic time for ur own family and family friends love you and miss y’all bunches and bunches merry Christmas.oh and the BURROONS! Peace ✌🏿
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for the student assistant position at the University of Florida in Gainesville, Florida was okay - it was not bad at all and did not take a very long time.
Interview Questions: They did not ask me anything?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Questions were all about professional development and grant funding. They weren't hard questions and it was overall very short (15 minutes). More of a screening interview. I wasn't really what they were looking for. Make sure to know about Math Nation - I did not.
Interview Questions: Describe a professional development that you helped create that you would consider to be innovative.

title: Multimedia Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: The process took two weeks; I had one phone interview for 20 minutes and then a 45 minute Zoom interview about ten days later. After the final interview, I was ghosted and had to check my UFlorida portal to see I didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: How has your video skills evolved over the years?

title: Engineering Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty brief. I first introduced myself then was asked about 5 questions related to the job. The two interviewers were nice. The interview lasted about 15 minutes. I had to plan ahead for my interview and move my schedule. They seem to have looked closely at my resume
Interview Questions: What experience do you have mentoring others? What experience do you have in public speaking?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Regular process for tenure track positions. Screening interview, then on campus visit and meetings, submitting multiple materials and references at each stage. Campus visit was during a nice time of the year so it was pleasant
Interview Questions: Research trajectory and overall goals

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was manageable. I attained my first choice of a project even though there were other projects that were interesting. The person I talked with was pleasant, so overall it was a positive experience.
Interview Questions: List your project choice preferences in ascending order.

title: Legal Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Basic on site interview with just the director who placed emphasis on prior experience, schedule, etc. Background search took about two weeks. Overall very easy and no hassles. Didn't have any trouble as far as I recall.
Interview Questions: They asked about schedule and prior experience

title: Group Fitness Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Easy and chill. Good process, already pretty much knew I'd be hired. No need to stress if you are AFAA certified. The bosses are super nice and don't make you stress out at all.
Interview Questions: Are you certified through AFAA and CPR

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly interview that allowed me to feel comfortable in the environment. I was given many opportunities to share about my passions and interests and what makes me qualified for the role.
Interview Questions: What made you apply for this position?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Had two interviews. First a phone interview then a zoom interview. This took place over about two weeks. I was told that they would follow up as they were looking to fill the position soon. Ghosted, saw on workday that they rejected. Seriously, take 20 seconds and send out an email.
Interview Questions: How would you be a good fit? Etc

title: Marketing and Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: I had several interviews in one day with marketing and admissions teams, senior directors, and the hiring manager. There were typical questions about work experience as well as behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: If you had an unlimited budget, what marketing tactics would you focus on implementing?

title: Nursing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Jacksonville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Interview and background screening after fifteen days and then we have to provide al documents  and pass the state board of  licensing examination to be qualified to work there. And if delay in submitting documents will delay in placement but will be saved your place.
Interview Questions: Why do you wanna work here

title: Technology Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Simple, went through a process of talking about myself, why I want to work there. As well as my technical abilities and people skills. They focus on how well you would do interacting with difficult situations.
Interview Questions: How would you act if someone became hostile?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: It was a great experience. Everyone was really friendly; very short and wanted to see that you were dedicated and hardworking. Great hours and very accommodating ; got holidays and summers off
Interview Questions: Why did you want to work here

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was really lengthy process, it tool over two months to do the campus visit.  I went above and beyond and they sounded very sincere only to my shock they took the other candidate.
Interview Questions:
How do you see yourself in five years?
what grants you will be applying to when you get here?

title: Remote Medical Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Florida in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Interview with Donna HIM dept 
Very professional and straight to the point 
I was emailed a very professional invite for online interview and she was punctual and thorough 
She also said she would get back to me
Interview Questions: Years of experience and details about experience

title: Resident Assistant (RA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Filled out an online form to apply, was contacted by email to schedule an interview, and eventually emailed with a job offer. Wasn't too bad at all. Definitely on the easier side.
Interview Questions: What past leadership experience do you have that would make you a good fit to be a Resident Assistant?

title: Executive Producer, WUFT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Virtual panel interview. Everyone was professional and engaged. Questions were reasonable and clearly based off the job description. No zingers. I felt welcome and heard and I was impressed with their vision.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience with DEI.

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Everyone was kind and professional from the initial zoom interview, to planning my campus interview, and through the actual interview day. I would be happy to work there, given the chance.
Interview Questions: I was asked about application of 21st skills in the classroom.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: very simple, went to professors office chatted and got hired. i emailed twice after a general search went out and he appreciated my persistence. advice is to keep trying until you get it.
Interview Questions: What are your hobbies outside work?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Jacksonville, FL) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very Good General interview questions, somewhere personal questions to like about character and such General interview questions, somewhere personal questions to like about character and such General interview questions, somewhere personal questions too like about character and such
Interview Questions: General interview questions, somewhere personal questions too like about character and such

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions:
One interview. Two people from my department interviewed me via zoom. 

Interview questions were easy. Interviewers we’re nice and friendly. I enjoyed the interview and was offered a part time position as a student assistant
Interview Questions: What is your school schedule for the semester?

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: It was just a one time interview, which lasted about an hour. It was relatively traditional and the interviewer was very friendly although she did not speak much herself. First she asked me questions about my background and then we discussed the job requirements etc.
Interview Questions: Hardest situation dealt with in a job setting

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions:
Submit the application on university website and they need three references letter before interview and need a cover letter. They didn’t do background check before onboard.
 Very quickly answer and one interview  with two professors.
Interview Questions:
What is your experience in clinical trials ?
Could you told me your survival analysis experience ?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: The interview process lasted for about 30 minutes, with a panel of two experts in the position. A first section of the interview was related to background, and then if you fit the culture of the research group.
Interview Questions: What were your past experiences in research?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Extremely fun place to be. A lot of activities to do and places to see in and around. Nice community and the professors are extremely helpful. Also they are one of top 5 public schools in the country
Interview Questions: as long as you want to learn they will provide an opportunity

title: Graduate Assistant - PhD Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant staff; it was easy to apply and set up an interview; I had prior communications with potential mentor/supervisor; easy and flexible scheduling; welcoming environment; interview setup was formal; three interviewers were present; asked questions about prior research experience, educational qualifications, what we like about the university and some casual conversations regarding the city
Interview Questions: Describe research interests, career plan

title: Graphic Designer II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions:
Two rounds of group Zoom interviews and a 1-on-1 with the Dean of that department. Interviews went fine, everyone was friendly enough. Asked pretty generic questions about my experience; nothing too crazy. 

What was upsetting was that I was offered the position, which I accepted, and was told the salary was negotiable. When I attempted to counter offer with a very reasonable salary bump, I was told the offer was rescinded. I was pretty shocked so I reached out and apologized for misunderstanding and they emailed back to say it had nothing to do with my counter offer. It was super shady and seemed sneaky and really put me off on UF as an employer. I'm still receiving random emails months later saying that they are "going with another applicant".
Interview Questions: They did seem to be concerned that I was going to dislike the "older" environment of the college?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: One meeting with all members from team and multiple 1 on 1 meeting with specific team members, asking behavioral and some technical questions. Questions mainly focus on experience on your resume.
Interview Questions:
Introduce your self.
Database related questions

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Consisted of a relatively simple interview along with a quick processing time after the interview was conducted. Friendly and open-ended questions were asked over a Zoom conference call. Required 2 interviews total that lasted about an hour.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses were asked

title: OPS Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: I met with three senior scientists and it was overall a great and comfortable experience.  They were all very kind and offered great insight into the requirements for the job.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with DNA purification?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: It was short and sweet, and the lab manager was really kind. I was shown around the lab and the work environment was friendly. I would recommend it, but it really just depends on your lab manager.
Interview Questions: How long do you plan to stay? When do you graduate? What is your major?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: The interview was over zoom, and the interviewer was very kind and warm. I was asked questions asked about my experience in this specific course, whether teaching or taking it, past related teaching jobs, etc.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in teaching?

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Quick, several questions about previous work but nothing difficult to answer on the fly. They asked about what I would bring to the table, all of the basic stuff. It was very short.
Interview Questions: How has my previous work in customer service made me a good fit for HR?

title: Data Analytics Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Florida in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had a virtual interview over Zoom with two members of the Business Career Services team. They took turns asking questions about my experience and what kind of programs/software/programming languages I was proficient in. It was more laid back than a typical behavioral interview and there goal was to understand my skills more than answer cliche interview questions.
Interview Questions: Elaborate on your experience doing data visualization.

title: Chemistry Lab Stockroom Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: My interviewer understood my background as a student and adjusted to my needs and history. The staff are efficient and diligent and helped the process go by smoothly and quickly
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Interview took place with a panel of current employees including potential future managers, supervisors, and other program managers. The questions were mostly scenario-based, asking how you would react in certain situations. They were very quick to get back to me and the whole process was very seamless. Timeline between submitting my application and being offered the position was roughly 3-4 weeks.
Interview Questions: Are you prepared to take on this role considering your future workload in the next semester(s)?

title: Call Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very informative and went by fast. They ask about your experience and things relevant to the job. Also talk about what can you bring to the table and what key skills and qualifications you have
Interview Questions: Tell me more about yourself

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: As they are non-profit, you navigate through several layers of info on the website and speak to multiple people.  It can take several weeks, which isn't helpful if you do not currently have a job.
Interview Questions: What is your management style?

title: Research Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Virtual via zoom, first with incumbent and then with faculty supervisor.  Faculty supervisor asked a lot of inappropriate questions, including asking  me what my race is.  Later he told me what race I would have to "play" during certain meetings.  Bizarre and horrible.  And no, he wasn't white.
Interview Questions: What are you-- your ethnicity?  No joke- second question I was asked.

title: Summer Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: They require you to submit a couple of documents and a letter of interest on why you wanted the internship.  It seemed to be just based on the documents you provided if you were considered or not.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back just wants to know if you had research experience before or not. Must be able to use excel. It is a one on one interview with the biomedical engineer and during the interview, they give you a tour of the place.
Interview Questions: Please elaborate on your research experience.

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: The process starts by sending a resume and a cover letter. Then if you are a good match and the skills match their required skills after submission you will be selected for an interview
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in this position?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was over zoom but they did not get back to me like they said they would. It took them way longer and I had to reach out to them.
Interview Questions: If a penguin wearing a sombrero walked into the room what would he say and do?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Online application that included an essay and multiple short answer questions that were around 300 words each. You also have to submit your resume and 1-3 letters of recommendation from teachers or other figures of authority. Overall it is very simple to apply.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you brought people together?

title: Grant Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was done in a video / Zoom format. Done panel style, with multiple interviewers. They had a standardized question list. It was a pleasant conversation. Interviewers were willing to answer questions.
Interview Questions: What are your three biggest strengths?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Easy process. Did not take long and smooth process. Detailed about what I'd be doing exactly and making sure I feel comfortable/would be willing to do work like that. Was a good experience and was one of the better interview processes I've had.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in the field?

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Easy questions. Everyone was kind and made you feel worthy. Have to take a fitness test: swim 300, tread for 1 minute, and show your rescue skills. Must be Red Cross Certified.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stressful situations?

title: Studio Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Overall, the interview process at the University of Florida Reitz Union isn't difficult. After submitting an application, candidates are invited to attend the first round of interviews, typically in a group setting. The goal is to see how well you perform in a team environment. The second round is individual, usually with 2-3 people present to interview you. The questions were typically focused on the specific role.
Interview Questions: Q: Tell me a little about yourself.

title: OPS Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (University Of, FL)
Interview Descriptions: The PI was a new professor and they called me on the phone and I answered and then I went to an interview in person at their office where they asked me questions about my experience. I was able to ask them about their research because I had looked up their publications beforehand. I reccomend demonstrating that your interested in science and knowledgeable about their unique subject. The PI called all of my references to confirm them.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience using animal models for research?

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with department director and then the whole team virtually. Questions were standard, experimental interview questions. Everyone was pleasant and professional. They were open to my questions as well, although the team did not seem fully prepared for interviewee questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you…(fill in the blank)

title: Students Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Zoom interview. I will receive a zoom link. Then, I will go to the link by the time. All interviewers were wearing face mask, so it may difficult to hear them clearly.
Interview Questions: What color would you desire yourself

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Group interview process. Three current resident assistants interviewed three of us that were applying to the job. An interviewer would ask a question to one of us.  At a certain point the interviewer would ask one of us what the other interviewee had said as the answer to their previous question.
Interview Questions:
Q: Why do you want to be an RA? 
Q: How do you feel you could help the residents?

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Because of COVID, they actually skipped the interview process and hired me directly. There were 5 people that got the position right off the bat. However, they were interviewing 7 other people.
Interview Questions: They did ask me to submit a personal statement about a book or movie that touched me.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly easy. They just wanted to know whether you had the time to do the tasks at hand and whether it was achievable to come in at least 6 hours a week, which in my opinion was very feasible. Simple, no pressure, and free-flowing conversation.

title: Application Developer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Had initial Zoom audio interview with 5 people. Mainly consisted of behavioral and situational questions. Then second Zoom video interview with a team of 8. Again, questions were mainly behavioral and situational with a few technical questions.
Interview Questions: What is the importance of OOP?

title: Visiting Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: I had to do an online interview via the skype video chat platform over the world wide web online platform. Lasted just about twenty minutes, otherwise known as one thousand and two hundred seconds.

title: Case Manager Interview

Interview Descriptions: First interview was with Manager then second was with 2 Case Managers. Both virtual. They basically spit fire questions and did not give a relaxed and friendly environment. I declined the offer mostly because the open position was not on a unit I wanted to work on and partly because the Case Management staff at the North Campus do not seem like they would be a pleasure to work with.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: I did not have an interview process to go through. I simply showed interest in a topic that my professor was researching. From there, my professor gave me the necessary information to be hired by the university and start receiving payments.

Interview Descriptions: Two part process. First a group interview with rotating panelist asking questions and group activities. Then three person panel in second interview. The second portion narrowed the group interview to three people with a panel.

title: Social Media Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was very professional and everyone was very warm and welcoming! They truly valued what I had to say and provided insightful answers to all of the questions that I asked
Interview Questions: Who would you have as a speaker?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Casual, conducted mostly over Skype. Overall quite pleasant and not too difficult. It took about an hour to an hour and a half, and the employer followed up a short time after
Interview Questions: Examples of experiences where I have demonstrated leadership

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Very brief technical interview. Was not a big deal. If you knew your stuff you were alright. Questions about whether or not you knew what you had to do to succed, etc.etc
Interview Questions: Solve the finite lattice representation problem.

title: Circulation Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Pretty long in terms on waiting but once you hear back they'll interview you and see if you are a good fit. I would say the hardest part was waiting to hear back
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked with customers before?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I met with the Professor and graduate student leading the research group. They then asked me about my availability and the role I desired to have. I elaborated about my experience taking courses such as digital logic and  reconfigurable computing.
Interview Questions: What role do you see yourself in this group?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed using Zoom and a round table of 7 professors who asked me questions relevant to my application. It was very casual and every professor asked me one question, ost of them expanding on information that was a part of my application. It was very lighthearted and I got to ask a few questions at the end about Gainsville and the campus.
Interview Questions: What am I looking for in my potential mentors?

title: Crew Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer followed up quickly to request interview after applying. Interview was held in an office next the Employee Relation office in the O’Connell center. Pretty standard…basic questions, about your work experience relates to the position, strengths and weakness.
Interview Questions: What prior experiences compliment the tasks of this job?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Was asked questions regarding prior knowledge and experiences in this subject matter. Later we discussed teaching styles and plans for the class and how it would differ from when I took the class.
Interview Questions: How would you manage to ensure punctual grading?

title: Veterinart Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Very fair and welcoming. Everyone was nice and made sure that I felt comfortable. I interviewed with two doctors who graduate from UF and were in private practice, along with a fourth year student.  Questions were behavioral. One ethical question.
Interview Questions: What is your thoughts on small animal euthanasia

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Jacksonville, FL)
Interview Descriptions:
After a positive phone interview, I received a request through HR asking me to come for an in-person interview with my prospective manager. When I arrived, I talked with the manager for 15 minutes, then went on to a panel interview that I was not advised of nor anticipating. It was not mentioned. After that, I was asked whether I wanted to meet the director (which I appreciate and enjoyed). The manager did not have time to finish up with me after because she was with another applicant. The entire process was around 3 hours (!!) long.

Because of the length of the interview and their interest in introducing me to many staff members, I felt moderately optimistic about my prospects. I didn't assume I would be offered the position. Imagine my surprise when they never reached out to me to inform me they had chosen someone else; I had to ask HR to look into it for me. If you invite someone back for a third, in-person interview with the manager, please at least do them the courtesy of letting them know you've moved ahead with someone else.
Interview Questions: How much do you know about UF Health's internal publications?

title: Computer Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: The IT director interviewed me in their office and asked me to figure out what 5 pieces of code were doing. I needed to give a complete idea of what was happening. I was asked some behavioral questions as well.
Interview Questions: Q: What do these pieces of code do? Q: What would you do in a stressful situation? Q: What experiences do you have?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: You will get into contact with an advisor, then you will have a short 10/20 min interview. The interview is mostly basic questions about who you are and why you would be a good student assistant
Interview Questions: What is something you didn’t write on your resume?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: I had a Skype interview with other lecturers in the UF and a few weeks after that they asked me to go for an on-campus interview. The on-campus interview was including presenting my teaching philosophy and teaching a class and many many meetings.
Interview Questions: why do you like teaching?

title: Student Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I came in and met with all the team members for the account I would be working on. The process was very laid back and made me feel very comfortable.
Interview Questions: What other brands have you worked on and what projects did you do?

title: Call Center Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: It comprised simple behavioral questions. Basically, the questions that are generic to any position really. You meet with the Collections department manager as well as the Call Center supervisor and they ask you questions, taking turns of course.
Interview Questions: Why the Bursar's Office?

title: Content Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: To help revive a department’s magazine, my first interview was with three people who would work with me on content. I had a timed task to complete (fix an old article that was written poorly). I advanced to a second interview with someone who did not have to do with the editorial team, but whose opinion was taken into account for much direction of the content.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Animal Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Very comfortable, was met by a manager to help me find the interview room. Friendly management very clearly knew who I was and asked in depth questions about my experiences.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience do you have working with large animals?

title: Tech Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Quick 2 week process. First is a very short and basic phone interview/screening. A week or so later is an in person interview with two managers. Bring a couple copies of your resume and prepare some questions for them to ask at the end of the interview (questions should be stuff that you cannot find online like what’s your experienced been in this role, do you have any feedback for me, etc.)
Interview Questions: Questions are fairly simple and behavioral with a focus on customer service experience.

title: Academic Technology Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is fairly short. About a week or two after applying online, you will be contacted via phone or email about scheduling an in-person interview. The interview is typically with 2 supervisors and lasts about 30 minutes. They are friendly and professional, so make sure to bring a couple copies of your resume to hand out and don't be afraid to talk to them like normal people (cause that is what they are!). The meeting runs through a few steps. First, they will tell you about the logistics of the job (what you do, where you may work, how much you may make, different routes for promotions). Ask any operational questions after this portion. Next, they will ask you some fairly easy hardware questions like what your experience with a Mac/PC is. Finally, they will ask you situational questions (these are probably the most important because they test your customer service). You will have time to ask them questions at the end. Make sure to come prepared with at least a few questions that you wouldn't be able to find by simply searching on google.
Interview Questions: Is the customer always right?

title: Nutrition Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, then got a call about a month later. The interview was about an hour. Had a small 10-minute presentation in front of a few people. Be sure to read on the website. Pay is not great, benefits are good. Good work-life balance.
Interview Questions: They asked about conflict resolution, teamwork abilities and experience with different types of audiences.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: I had to answer a lot of technical questions related to the position. Mostly from my resume and from my skill sets and the interview went for more than 2hrs. They gave me a break in between and they gave the result in one week
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you were asked to solve a complex problem

title: Studio Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Group then individual interview. The group interview was quite large, maybe 11 girls. There were teamwork problems and general discussions. Show interest in the studio during both interviews and you should do well.
Interview Questions: what is your spirit animal

title: UF IFAS Extension Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Florida in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview with one of the professors at the extension office. We arranged a time to speak to one another via email. When she called me, she first explained the position in more detail all the while asking me questions about how my experience would help me in the duties she mentioned.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Grant Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions:
Behavioral questions mostly.
Technical questions were moderate and not difficult
Lots of interpersonal skills would be a big help here
Focus on how to answer questions about solving specific tasks, accomplished and how was this done
Interview Questions: How would you respond to a fellow employee discussing critical and possibly controversial topics regarding politics, religion, sports, etc.?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: The process was very professional and clear. You start with an application and it takes a few weeks to receive a decision for the interview. The interview is a group panel interview with 3 interviewers (an RA, Graduate Community Coordinator, and Area Coordinator). You are seated alongside with two other candidates. The questions asked are different for each candidate so you may get a harder or easier question compared to the other candidates. After 35-50 minutes, we got moved to a different room to do a group activity. It was a nice way to finish the interview day because it’s less formal and fun. The final decision takes about 4 weeks. You either get denied, put in a pool (waitlist) or an offer. I was put in a pool initially but was given an offer for the Summer B and Fall semesters a week after I received my decision in an email.
Interview Questions: If you know someone is in trouble, what would you do?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Very easygoing and straightforward. Skype interview. Asked about skills, and experience. Not much negotiation on salaries. Research interest is the most important thing. As long as it matches, you can get the job easily.
Interview Questions: What statistical software do you use?

title: Conference Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Was a preliminary interview via video with 3 persons, done via video chat. I wish I had prepared more because I bombed but oh well. THey all seemed very nice, it was slightly intimidating being on video for me which was a first. But really seems like a great place to work.
Interview Questions: They asked alot of exploratory questions

title: Clinical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very concise to see if I was a good fit for the job. They also asked about certain skills and traits that would make me a good fit for the job.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose dentistry?

title: Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview takes place through ERAS. There are many facets to the process with collecting your data and submitting it. Interviews take place between October to January with the MATCH being conducted in May. There are no real predictors and the cost is outrageous.
Interview Questions: What lead you to seek this specialty?

title: Website Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Florida in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Employer asked for resume and any writing samples that I might have to show. During the interview, the Employer asked directed questions in reference to particular work experiences and reviewed the writing samples that I brought. Employer was interested in getting to know the future employee a bit to see what the overall goals for the employee as well as sharing the goals of the position. The interview process was not at all intimidating, but I would recommend confidence going in.
Interview Questions: How would you go about getting information from faculty members?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Very short, amiable and not hard at all. They want friendly employees who can comfortably work in a diverse environment where you have to talk to many international students. They do not look for much work experience but want a friendly and positive individual.
Interview Questions: How I deal with pressure

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Very standard interview. Basic questions of resume experience, what my five and ten year goals were and whether or not I saw myself growing within the company. Positive experience overall.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in ten years?

title: Crew Member At Stephen C O'Connell Center Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
General behavioral questions. Stress on teamwork and ability to collaborate. "Tell me about yourself" style questions.

There are three interviewers (college students), one supervisor from each type of shift: changeover, event, and tech. They were all kind and easy to talk to. Ironically, one of the interviewers was nervous.
Interview Questions: What type of Disney Princess would you be?

title: AV Personnel Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was very conversational, and the people I spoke with were very friendly! They assured me off the bat that they were fellow students, and it was very easy to relax and be open.
Interview Questions: What do you do in your free time?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Brief over the phone interview and then a more in-depth in person interview with a couple of people. The process was pretty seamless and they were very good with communication.
Interview Questions: Asked about strengths and weaknesses

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Screening phone, 1st round of panel interview by peer group, presentation onsite, followed by group interview and leadership individual interview. It has been a process to go through all the rounds. It is all mixed with behavioral questions, more field related questions etc.
Interview Questions: Would you please describe your professional achievement so far and why you are interested in this opportunity?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: I received an email stating I was selected for an interview. I was able to choose from different available dates and times for my interview.  It ended up being a group interview. A few weeks later I had a follow up phone interview.
Interview Questions: To give examples of different experiences I’d had with difficult provider’s or patient’s.

title: Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Applying for residency involved an online matching process. Many school/hospitals have different opinions about the importance of a visit or working interview. At UF the working interview is an emphasis.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite word?

title: Data Collector Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Informal interview on the phone and an immediate job offer! Very happy with this process. No longer work there but the position was a great temporary one and I enjoyed it very much.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in research?

title: Phone Interviewer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: They gave me a paper to read, then a mock phone interview was done.  Asked what I would do if somebody said something wrong. Finally , they explained me that I was going to work for 90 days as a trainee, then another final test to see if I was going to be selected to work with them permanently.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do in this job?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: It was friendly process. The focus was both on skill sets as well as interpersonal skills. There was a phone interview followed by a on-site interview. There was an oral seminar presentation and meeting with 5 other faculty members and lab members
Interview Questions: Describe your strength and weaknesses

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Ok for whomever is reading this I just have to say that the interview process has been a nightmare with UF. I have been applying continually and interviewing since November of 2017 and it is April 2018  (5 months!) and no luck. Everyone keeps telling me how impressive my CV is and go for initial interviews but afterwards the job posting either gets cancelled, re-posted, or given to someone within internal. I mean what is going in there...if job a position gets posted and there is someone already selected for the position before even getting the dam job posted please don't waste us peoples energy, time and anxiety through all that process of interviewing. There is one job posting that I interviewed back in February and it still says "In review" I am about to just give up with applying here and go elsewhere.
Interview Questions: What is one thing that can improve on our hiring process?

title: Fiscal Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer gave off the impression that I was wasting his time.  He acted like he had better things to do than to sit there and act like he was interested in interviewing me.
Interview Questions: Why was I being laid off from my current job

title: Stephen C O'Connell Center Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: The SCOC part time job at UF has a two phase interview process. First phase requires an online application along with a resume, many  'Why SCOC questions' and many  'Why You' questions. This is the most challenging phase. Although, if you have referrals it is quite easy to get an interview call. The interview comprised of behavioral questions and lasted for around 10 minutes. I was informed in late evening about the offer. Almost, most of the people get an offer if they are shortlisted for interview process.
Interview Questions: Previous Experience

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I submitted  my resume and my cover letter. I received an email for a formal interview and had a standard interview. The interviewer was positive and helpful and asked me some personality based questions. The whole process took about two weeks.
Interview Questions: How would you resolve a conflict?

title: Marketing Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: First I did a short phone interview. Then I was invited for an in-person interview with three people. The questions were on point and it was more of a conversation than a Q&A talk.
Interview Questions: Do you know about graphic design?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: No interview since I was a graduate student. It is an auto process of staying as a GRA. But it depends on which department you are in, our department has higher GRA salary than others.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Quality Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: One short onsite interview with two hiring managers. The interview was about 20 minutes long and was asked about 12 questions. Interviewers were not hostile and were friendly.  There were two interview days for all candidates and we waited together in a holding room before being called back individually
Interview Questions: Had me do a sales pitch regarding software that was used on job

title: ACT I Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Florida in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very short, no chance to ask more questions, no chance to go into depth about what was expected.  Just no immediate answer for if you get the job or not.
Interview Questions: Describe a team work experience

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Three on one with staff and immediate supervisor. Fairly intimate setting in bosses office. Several questions asked on both sides. Not only experience but also with personal interests. Difficult questions from one on the interviewers that could have made or break the interview. The questions were more based on personality but could be considered helpful with narrowing down similar candidates. Typical hours liked to work but it's a variable job so didn't know if that assisted with my not getting hired.
Interview Questions: Who is your role model/hero and why?

title: Veterinary Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took about 2 months. Part one of interview was a one on one with the technician manager. Next, it was a panel interview with all the doctors of the service.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you made a mistake and how you fixed it?

title: Preview Staffer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: There are three rounds of interviews. First round is a group interview, the second is with staffer and faculty member, and the third round is with the professional staff team.
Interview Questions: Why does diversity mean to you?

title: Admissions Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Met with the Assistant Director of Admissions and the immediate supervisor for the department. They asked me about myself and my experience and then they told me all about the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: The interview was brief and friendly. Not many Technical questions were asked. They were ready with my resume and had much knowledge already. They liked my conduct and personality and so offered me the position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Event Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: To begin with, I had to submit an online application and then I was contacted to participate in one on one interview. After I was hired, I had to provide HR with my documents and go through orientation.
Interview Questions: What is your previous experience in customer service?

title: Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very informative about the position. Very friendly and asked a few technical questions here and there but mainly behavioral questions and largely about the project/research the team does. Very friendly hiring managers/Principal investigators. And very helpful co workers
Interview Questions: A few questions about my skills and if I was comfortable working with mice

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: You have to meet the key people in the department and convince them that you are a suitable candidate for the job.  All they want to see is seriousness in attitude.
Interview Questions: What are your skillsets?

title: Operations Associate At Rec Sports Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: The interview was honestly humiliating and the worst interview experience I have ever been through. It was a group interview of 16 people, all fighting over the attention of five supervisors. We were split into groups of four, with a supervisor to evaluate our ability to solve a problem as a team. There was obvious favoritism as the supervisor for my group was giving high fives to my fellow team members and asking them how they were doing. We were then asked to come up with a group presentation within our group on a topic that was given to us. My group presented, and the evaluator asked us questions condescendingly and shook his head when we didn't "answer correctly", essentially embarrassing us in front of the group. For a job that pays minimum wage, this interview was absolutely unnecessary! I also thought it was very strange that they had a photo of me from my student ID on their evaluation sheet before I walked into the interview. This makes me think that potential discrimination could have taken place.
Interview Questions: If you were to put together a presentation to new operational associates, how would you present the information?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Online application through University of Florida jobs. They will contact you with an email for an interview. They offered for an in person or Skype interview. Two people interviewed me with mostly behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: What are your new ideas for social media?

title: Assistant Director for Career Education and Exploration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process consisted of a phone interview, then an on campus interview. The phone interview focused on my educational and professional background. The on campus interview focused on: 

- sharing with the staff and faculty about my professional experiences
-giving a  presentation about supporting graduate and international students
- learning about the functions of career services on campus
Interview Questions: How would you support graduate and international students on campus?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied on UF Jobs online and heard back about a week later for an interview.  Interview was board style via Skype due to me being out of state.  I heard back a day later scheduling a follow up one on one interview via Skype with the vice chairman of the department.  About 4 days later (weekend included) I heard back and was informed that I was the top candidate and after a background check would receive a job offer.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself using 3 adjectives.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Florida (Jacksonville, FL) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: A recruiter will contact for an interview with manager. Then the manager will arrange the meeting. will meet with a manager and nurses team. the recruiter offered in 2 days.
Interview Questions:
tell me about yourself?
strength and weakness.
how do you deal with conflict?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and heard back within five days by phone. The on site interview process took one day and was a one on one interview with a graduate student.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weakness?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Got the call from hiring manager to set up a phone interview. One week later got another call about skype interview. Then they checked my references and moved forward to background check. Then I got the offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time that you multitask and how's the result

title: Down to Earth Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was not stressful, people were down-to-earth, welcoming, and friendly.  Multiple interviewers, allowed time for questions and presentations. I was called for a second-round interview within the week. I was from out of town so they also were flexible with starting date.
Interview Questions: What was my experience with international education programs and traveling internationally,

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is lengthy (consisting of phone and on-site interviews) and you can go months without hearing any information. The on-site interview is a full day of meeting with different departments , presenting on a specified topic and ending with a dinner.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a difficult employee interaction and explain how you resolved it.

title: Extension Agent Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Was called by phone to interview within a few weeks of submitting my application. 2 interviewed people were selected to do a presentation before the county extension office they would be working with.
Interview Questions: What did I know about IFAS? Did I know any extension agents? What was my ideal working situation? Questions pertaining to the job description were asked.

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Tampa, FL) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for a phone interview and then a panel interview. Several days later, I had a chance to give a presentation via skype. Interviewers were friendly and polite. However, in the last interview, I made a mistake and didn't get the offer.
Interview Questions: What skills can you bring to this lab?

title: Extension Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a panel interview with 5 people. The interview took place in Gainesville on the UF campus. I interviewed specifically for the Florida Friendly Landscaping (FFL) Extension Agent I position. After the interview process two people were chosen for a seminar phase, where you had to talk/teach about a specific topic.
Interview Questions:
They asked me what I knew about IFAS.
They asked me specific questions about the program I would be hired on with, like the 9 FFL principles.
Why did I want to work for IFAS?
How I prefer a supervisor to work with me?
What are my hobbies?

title: Visiting Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Lake Alfred, FL) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to interview at  Citrus Research and Education Center. The interviewer was kind. He asks me about my research proposal and the option of applying for a grant. I explain about my intention to introduce a new technique  for HLB early detection.
Interview Questions: They asked me mainly about my research project

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Interview was with the Professor only, he asked about my research background and explained his. The interview was about one hour. I explained the bullet points of my resume, and the similarities between our field of work.
Interview Questions: Are you thinking about staying in the academia?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: the interview was really interesting . They asked a lot of engagement and building the community. I mentioned I really liked sport and they put me in the Ethletic LLC community.
Interview Questions: Whats your favorite area, the kitch, bathroom or living room

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Met with all coworkers and answered all the normal interview questions and came back to meet with all supervisors in the department. It was not that difficult of a process. Applied online and heard back 2 weeks later
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Discussed with faculty of the department my desire to pursue a graduate degree at UF. Took a tour of the UF campus to determine if it suited me or not. Talked with other graduate students in the department.
Interview Questions: What are your research interests?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was casual, but this varies depending on which lab you apply for. Just be prepared to talk about your studies and ambitions as a researcher, they are always looking for undergraduates' help.
Interview Questions: What are your goals in this lab?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: First a phone interview was conducted and then afterwards an in-person interview. The in-person interview also had a tour of the lab facility. The interview lasted about 10 minutes and I was given time to ask the interviewers my own questions.
Interview Questions: Please describe a time you worked in a team?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Very informal and easy to handle. The one hour didn't feel that long with each professor. Had to meet 3-4 professors, discuss about your research experience and your future goals and listen to their research interests. The professors also explained about the working styles in their environments and showed around their lab and labmates.
Interview Questions: What has been your research experience and what are you interested in working in the future?

title: Pediatric/Infectious Disease Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied with CV and cover letter. Got an interview. Had dinner with team the night before. Spent the day interviewing. Got a verbal offer by the end of the day, and a written offer by the following week.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Web Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Florida (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: It's not one-on-one: generally there are several people in the room asking questions. We all sat in a conference room and there were both formal questions and open conversation with a chance to see if the personalities meshed. It lasted a little over an hour.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years?

title: SCOC Crew Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, heard back a week later. Went in and met with three supervisors, they asked me a few questions. I left then waited a couple days to find out the result. I then had orientation a week after that , which was ac couple hours long. Overall it wasnt too hard of an experience and it didnt take way too long for it all to be completed.
Interview Questions: If you were a Kitchen Utensil what would you be ?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: You have to take a course named Mgmt of Unit operations in a chemical engineering department. Its a graduate course of 3 credits. If you perform well in that course, you will be selected for part-time teaching assistant and get paid.
Interview Questions: Explain chemical engineering unit operations involved in experiments such as batch/continuous distillation or cooling tower?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was very calm; the professor asked me a couple questions about the class and that was pretty much it. Besides that, the professor asked me about my background in teaching, I said that I had none and it was no issue at all.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to teach?

title: OPS Pediatrics Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was called to interview that day and received the job offer on the same day. This is not typical to UF.  Being OPS at UF is a way to get your foot in the door, but not an ideal employment situation as you have no benefits.
Interview Questions:
What make you a good candidate for this job?
What are you passionate about?

title: FNP Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Florida in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: A panel of peers interviewed with different questions. A presentation was required but note cards were allowed and an outline was given to help prepare.  After about a week I was offered the position and then had to wait three months for paperwork, processing and background checks until I was able to start.
Interview Questions: Normal interview questions ie. Tell us how you are a leader, Tell us how you work under pressure, are you a self starter etc

title: Softball Official Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was a group setting on a panel interview. Asked why you wanted to work there and what RecSports means to you. They were very kind and wanted to make sure you were comfortable.
Interview Questions: What RecSports meant to you? The answers from everyone varied to this question because no one was expecting it. It took me a few seconds to think of something to say.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: You have the most seniority...you want this job?  I had been a graduate student with external funding for 3 years.  So getting offered funding for one semester from UF was not really a big deal
Interview Questions: Q: You want the job?

title: Os Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a group panel interview, consisting of six members of the professional staff and 6 individuals up for promotion. Each individual up for promotion was given the opportunity to be the first to answer a question and this proceeded down the line of interviewees. The interview ended with a Q and A segment.
Interview Questions: How do you manage conflict?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: you apply online, wait a few weeks for the supervisor to review resumes and select top applicants for interview, received an email requesting an interview, planned interview, did interview within a couple days, received a call with an offer less than a week after.
Interview Questions: describe your leadership style

title: Teaching Lab Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
2 interviews.
The first one was one hour, interviewed by 3 different professors/former worker. Typical interview questions, followed by a simulation of a typical lab. 3 choices provided: pH tests, spectrophotometers, acid/base titration. 
The second one was just meeting with your future boss, the departmental dean, for detail personal questions.
Very easy, but long time.
Interview Questions: What's your passion? What's your 5 year career goal? Why you apply for this job? How did you deal with challenge?

title: Educational Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Initial telephone interview and then face-to-face two weeks later.  Initial screening process began with a telephone interview.  Within two weeks I was asked for a face-to-tace interview.  This was a 1:1 interview with the Grant Writer of the project and the other specialist via on-line connection - she was out-of-sate.

The interview seemed very straight forward for the position.  I felt very hopeful after being told I was one of only three candidates being interviewed in-person; after initial screening.   

At the end of the interview I was given a brief tour of working space and told that the decision would be made within a week.  Three weeks later I was sent a canned 'email' thanking me for my time and they had hired another candidate, not from the interviewer, but from someone in Human Resources.

I would have preferred a direct call. from the director or interviewe me, with personal feedback and/or constructive criticism.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience running/monitoring a project.

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Jacksonville, FL) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
