Smooth process with excellent communication from all parties.
It was first a phone interview.
Onsite interview was offered approximately 2 weeks later.
There were two onsite interviews.
Offer was made about a week after the onsite interview.
Interview Questions: About previous experiences in the setting for which you are interviewing.

title: Immigration Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by 10 people together. They were all very nice. Each of them asked one or two questions. I thought I did well in the interview and my experience fits the position. Three weeks after the interview, they sent me an email saying they hired another candidate. I guess they preferred someone who has UF background.
Interview Questions:
How do you say No to your client?
What service your previous school didn't provide and you think it is necessary?

title: Ra Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I left to the university. The interview Had medium level questions mostly about the skills that i had mentioned on my resume.
It had 2 rounds mostly skill related and was conducted by 4 people.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience

title: Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: submit the application, cover letter, and recommendation letter online, then directly went to a interview meeting with 3 faculty members. The a quiz for how to conduct a typical experiment in a lab. Overall half an hour. Then the other day, finally interview with your supervisor or departmental dean.
Interview Questions: Self introduction. Reasons for applying this job. Your personality. The biggest challenge you have ever had. What if you have to work with extra time. What is your passion. What is the 5 year career goal.

title: Accounting Coordinator III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Supervisor was very nice and asked a lot of questions related to work experience, hobbies and general needs as an employee. I liked the culture there and decided it was a good fit. In hindsight I think she gave a fair representation of the university and I'm glad I decided to take the job.
Interview Questions: What hobbies do you have?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Fairly smooth. Interviewer asked about what projects I have worked on, my experience with certain skills that are necessary for this position (programming, simulation etc.) and then they talked about their projects and my future role.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your projects and if you have worked with gov. data.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I went in and applied heard nothing back for a year later went and emailed hr. Got a call back within weeks did 2 interviews 2 weeks apart mini test of skills and boom I was hired.
Interview Questions: What was a time you had to held disclose information

title: Digital Media Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Sit down with the heads of the department and we spoke about what the job entailed and what I could bring to the table. I Went over my experiences and showed interest in their overall goal.
Interview Questions: What programs are you most efficient in?

title: Field Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Florida (Vero Beach, FL) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Application required a current CV and cover letter, with preference given to those with insect and/or cervid experience. Professor called to talk and explain the job and pay in greater detail, but no formal interview was conducted.
Interview Questions: What sort of experience do you have working with deer and insects?

title: University Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Not too tedious at all. They did ask some technical questions, but that is too be expected. In addition they wanted references, some previously worked projects, and an explanation of yourself and why you wish to work here.
Interview Questions: What is one aspect of the university, coming from a disparate job, you think could be changed?

title: Event Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of multiple rounds of interviews first, a one on one then, a group setting interview with future coworkers, and then a final one on one interview. All interviews took place on the the same day.
Interview Questions: What is the biggest misconception about this industry?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty laid back. There were three student managers in the room. They asked the typical questions such as your weaknesses and strengths. They also asked everyone a funny, silly question at the end.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the program online and received an invitation for a site visit where I spoke with several professors about their research projects. One professor and I mutually agreed on a position.
Interview Questions: What are your research interests?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an application online. The application included my resume and transcript. Overall it was very straight forward. Then I got called in for an interview really soon. My interviewer is now my boss, it was a 30-60 min process and very comfortable and laid back. The most challenging part was finding the building.
Interview Questions: How would you handle this situation if you were a tutor?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was between me and a Mechanical Engineering student. I had to get 4 GPA in my Masters program to obtain the PhD project under Dr. Ladd.  I had a 1:1 interview with my future advisor.
Interview Questions: What is your GPA?

title: Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: The leader of engineer asks me about questions of database and web development ,like the order of execution of SQL language, php, html, and how a webpage is retrieved .
Interview Questions: How a webpage is retrieved when you go to a website

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: It took three whole days. I had to meet with faculty of the department and then visit the various labs. After that I had to give a one hour presentation followed by a closed door meeting with the faculty. After that I was meeting with the graduate students. Lastly I had to meet with all the deans and complete my paper work with the HR.
Interview Questions: What are your goals?

title: IT Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Asked for resume and asked what previous information technology assistance experience I had, gave them schedule of hours that i could work during. Basic stuf like what OS i have experience using and if I had any hardware expertise
Interview Questions: General behavior Questions

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: They invited me to a room where they asked me basic questions. What would co workers say about you.  They just wanted to see if I was a decent guy
Interview Questions: Like tell me about yourself?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Three workers are in the interview process and they ask you questions about your experience in Gatornights. The only aspect I found that I didn't like is that they rejected my application by email and I was already interviewing for other jobs then I get a phone call saying that they in fact did want me to work with them.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a customer is giving you a hard time

title: O'Connell Center Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed alone, but about 5 people interviewed me at once. They were really sweet and easygoing and asked normal as well as fun to answer questions! Even though there was more than one person interviewing me it was one of the least scary interviews I've experienced. I would suggest dressing business casual.
Interview Questions: If you could be a Disney princess, which would you want to be and why?

title: At CFA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant and friendly, really connected with the interviewer, who ended up being my boss. No trick questions, just the basics to see if you'd do a good job and gauge your interest in which department of the college you'd be most interested in working with.
Interview Questions: Basic questions

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Florida (Jacksonville, FL) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Directly with the manager. Mostly ask about schedule and behavioral questions. You have to make sure you are very flexible with your hours because since you are a student that is their biggest concern
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you've worked under pressure

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Short, to the point and not too difficult. Was made comfortable enough to not worry and be calm. Very punctual. Gave the work from the very moment interview ended. A good experience.
Interview Questions: Previous experience in the same field

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Finding a dissertation advisor is an important step in a PhD Student's academic journey. I set up times to meet with prospective advisors and discussed their work, funding, etc. They in turn ask about my background to see if I mesh with their current research. All pretty straightforward. Decisions on offering a position in the group are pretty immediate as the professor will know right away if your skills and their funding match up.
Interview Questions: Describe any group projects you took part in.

title: Fitness Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with a presentation portion followed by a panel interview. Presentation required you to come up with a 60 second commercial advertising the department of recreational sports. Then we sat in groups of 2-5 for a panel style interview.
Interview Questions: Strengths, Weaknesses, Leadership questions

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Professor emailed me asking me if I wanted to do it due to a good referral, I approved and said yes, I would like the job. Then she interviewed me making sure I was familiar with class material and could manage 100 students, and that was it.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with the program we have to use and how?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my resume, I was contacted by my future supervisor and called in for an interview. Once I got to the office, I was sat down in a room with my future supervisor and asked about 10 question. The process was very straightforward and everyone was pleasant.
Interview Questions: How do you practice incorporating diversity into your life?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two stage interview process where I initially met with the lab coordinator and accountant, second interview was conducted with two PIs and the lab coordinator and questions focused on prior work experience, volunteering, future goals, and current knowledge
Interview Questions: How I plan on moving forward in my career

title: Senior Biological Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Basically, I interviewed with Principle Investigators, and they were not trained HR people.  So the questions were pretty basic and simple to answer.  Most of the interviews were 1 on 1 - a couple I had met several people.
Interview Questions: Hardest one - What do you not like to do?

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Process took two weeks, applied online met in Gainesville and spoke to the HR recruiter who then referred me to the Admissions manager. I then spoke about payroll and growth expectations.
Interview Questions: How will you bring hype to the university of Florida

title: Extension Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application, CV and letter of intent online. Later, I received a phone call from the District Extension Director who had some qualifying questions before notifying me I would receive an onsite interview. I attended a panel interview with county Extension agents via polycom plus had one-on-one interviews with the DED and IFAS administration in Gainesville. The onsite interview lasted 3+ hours.
Interview Questions: There were situational questions tailored to the position for which I was applying and questions that focused on my educational philosophy.

title: Information Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
4 individuals took my interview. It was partly behaviorial questions, partly going through the resume and partly questions about the job description.The interviewers were friendly and easy-going. It was not difficult at all, however, a good preparation of the job description and what you can offer to the position will make you a strong candidate. 
The interview lasted 30 minutes with questions from the panel.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Great interview! Interviewers were very laid back. If you can convince them of your great attitude you already have a leg up! They are specifically looking for young people that they can train early on and that will stay for several years so they don't have to retrain every year.
Interview Questions: What's your biggest strength?

title: Software Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Boulder, CO) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: A phone interview with the head developer. The interviewer was very informal and cordial. I had a great image of the company afterwards. Even though I did not answer all of his questions correctly (due to an insufficient programming background on my part), the interviewer talked me through some of the solutions and paid more attention to my thought process than whether I knew the answer.
Interview Questions: How would you use Lists in Python to make a "set" data type?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone conversation to establish intent and interest,  Job seminar to describe research program.  Series of Interviews.  Follow up interviews with the family to tour the university and local town environment.
Interview Questions: What are your academic goals?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
It was a short presentation but a lot of questions I have got. 
One day interview was all and I could see I'm admitted at the right on site.
And a week later, I got an official offer letter from my department. 
Usually, it takes over half year if you are rejected.
Interview Questions: Briefly present my dissertation topic.

title: Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied through posting.  Coordinated a phone interview.   Got offer the next day and accepted.   Downside was zero training or annual calendar.   I have gotten in trouble for not completing tasks that were not on my job listing
Interview Questions:
How would you deal with a student in crisis?
What is your experience with NERDC?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, two one on ones and a panel interview. Very standard questions. Nothing out of the ordinary. Walked through resume, answered some basic questions - a few situational questions.
Interview Questions: How do you handle dealing with a difficult team member?

title: Imaging Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a quick and informal interview to make sure my schedule fit with theirs. We emailed about the details of my schedule and meeting and how much i wanted to work. We met to see if our personalities were compatible. Very informal and easy to get the job.
Interview Questions: What is schedule like

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was relatively simple. I called the adviser before even coming to UF, and had multiple discussions with him. Then, when I came to visit, I had a in-person interview and got to tour the lab and talk with current lab members.
Interview Questions:
What type of problem do you enjoy working on.
Tell me a bit about your prior experience in this subject.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very Basic interview process. Knew lab I was interviewing for so it made everything much simpler. Should come eager to research a specific topic and all will go well. Some people ay start volunteering just to get to know people in lab.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join this lab

title: Technical Reporting Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Florida (Jacksonville, FL) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very informal.  Met first with HR and then with the team.  Pretty standard interview questions.  It was very relaxed and informal.  Seemed like a good work environment.  Finished  with a lengthy test of skills.
Interview Questions: Describe strength/weaknesses.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: The usual. Interview process. Was called for interview and was asked to select a time slot. Was nervous but the interviewer made me feel at home and asked me basic questions and I was offered the job.
Interview Questions: None actually

title: Learning Support Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Florida in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Heard back about a week after applying.  There was 1 phone call interview that lasted about 20 minutes.  A big factor in the hiring process was my availability for the entire summer. On the application, it said that Summer availability was preferred but my interviewer seemed to greatly prioritize it
Interview Questions: Why did you choose CS as your major?

title: Community Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I got referred by my friends, then was scheduled a time to talk with the director, start with a brief self introduction, she asked me some question about the project planning and activity organization experience.
Interview Questions: do you have any experience about organizing an activity?

title: House Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy. Over the phone since I already was a past brother.
Interview Questions: Q: Why would you like to live at the house? What are your best leadership qualities?

title: Physician Assistant Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Four day interview process (less if out of state applicant) including orientation, group interview, individual interviews, and interactions with current class. There were several staff members and current class students present through out the process. Very laid back and professional. Made you feel at home.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weakness?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Given a problem & asked to write MATLAB code. Was given 2 weeks to submit. Had to read a paper and implement an algorithm. The paper was a well known one in the area of research.
Interview Questions: Given a problem & asked to write MATLAB code

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: I contacted this particular principle investigator through an annual scientific conference. They had a process to connect soon-to-be graduates with prospective employers. After returning home (I still had to defend my thesis) the employer invited me to come visit his his lab and the University. He paid all expenses. We seemed to get on well and he was very excited about the prospect of my coming to work there. he made it clear I was the top candidate. In short, he promised me the moon.  It all sounded very good, but i had a tiny voice in my head telling he might be crazy. Against my better instincts, I took the job, moved myself and my family and proceeded to live in 2 years of hell. I was young and naive. the most I took away from this position was the ability to deal with extremely difficult people.  He was a very intelligent and technically skillful man and I did learn a lot from him, but in the end, it was a miserable experience.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself 5 years from now

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Florida (Richmond, VA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone call with major advisor and a meet and greet dinner with the lab. Discussed research interests over the phone for roughly 1 hour. Following an application process for graduate school through the university, I was given an offer.
Interview Questions: Research interest, past experiences with academics/research

title: AV Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: A panel of 4. The interview lasted for about 35min. Not much. just general HR questions. strengths  and weaknesses, how do you de-stress yourself? How will this opportunity help you in your future endeavours. Explain anyone challenging situation that you overcame.  Expectations from this job.any questions that you would like to ask ?
Interview Questions: Strength and weakness

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: personal discussion on experience in web developer and very casual discussion on how that experience enhanced your knowledge and helped you in your career growth process personal discussion on experience in web developer and very casual discussion on how that experience enhanced your knowledge and helped you in your career growth processpersonal discussion on experience in web developer and very casual discussion on how that experience enhanced your knowledge and helped you in your career growth process
Interview Questions: not very difficult

title: Gallery Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I just came in and the boss asked me a few questions about whether or not I would be able to do the duties or come in on Saturdays.
Interview Questions: Can you come in on Saturdays?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: As a student, I received notice of the job opening via an e-mail listserv. I completed the online application and a few days later received an e-mail from the research study Principal Investigator requesting a Skype interview since it was summer time and I was not back in town for school yet. I completed the Skype interview and was asked to come in for an in-person interview as soon as I returned for school. I was offered the job immediately after the in-person interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience and what you learned when you worked at ______.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Florida in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The process took one week.The professor sent me an email asking if i was interested in been a teaching assistance for his class.
Interview Questions: It was a behavioral and technical interview.

title: Photographer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Met the editor and rest of the staff. Several rounds of conversations with each team that took around 1 hour in total. Very friendly and eager to talk to me. The conversation was easy, it was very relaxed. Just went through my resume and talked about the expectations for the new position.
Interview Questions: How do you work in a team?

title: IT Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone interview, panel. From there I was called in for an interview panel, multiple questions, all technical and related to the job I was applying for. I have been through several interviews at UF and many of them have had the same format.
Interview Questions: Prepare for technical questions if applying for a technical job

title: Building Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Short interview. Pretty straightforward like a conversation.  Sat down with the Ops manager and some student staff and they took turns asking questions. More or less wanted to see my attentiveness to detail and customer service ability. As well as my ability to stay calm under pressure.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Academic Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Job was posted on UF website and after applying I was called for a face to face interview by a search committee. A few days later I was informed I had the job,
Interview Questions: When will you be graduating and do you plan on staying in Gainesville?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Met with the hiring manager, and a peer the interview was very relaxed and informal and lasted less then an hour.  Met with the manager first and then the peer interviewer was brought in and asked questions.
Interview Questions: How do handle another employee that may be "breaking the rules"?

title: Recruitment Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: The process a fast especially several people applied to the position.  For this particular process, I applied and one week later I received a phone call for an interview.  The interview was with the hiring manager, and I was able to get a sense of the hiring manager along with the team.  The culture for higher education is different from private sector, but I did get a sense of the team I will be working with and I was looking forward to it.  The hiring manager was very friend and really made me felt at ease.
Interview Questions: they utilize competency based interview questions

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Apply through the O'Connell website . After some time they'll shortlist you from your submitted resume and schedule an interview. One round interview process and it is very easy to get through it as the questions are normal behavioral ones. Always mention things like customer satisfaction and exceeding expectation kind of stuff on your resume or description.
Interview Questions: your role model from past and present?

title: Senior Graphic Design Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: I applied though the university's system online w/ a resume and pdf portfolio, received a call within days for an interview. The boss and her assistant were very friendly, asked appropriate questions about the work i presented. I also had to do a test project on site, spontaneous. They called me within a week or so to offer the position, assuming my background check cleared.
Interview Questions: I was asked to recall some of the fonts i had used on certain projects.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Did a phone interview and face to face interview. Very laid back in the face to face ( they knew they wanted to offer the job).
Interview Questions: None, questions about research perceptions and how to handle bad days/patients

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Applied online didnt hear back for 6 months until their student assistant quit
Interview Questions: Do you know about the Co-Lab series the library puts on?

title: Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions:
Simple interview process. 
Submitted CV ad resume via e-mail
Interview Questions: None were too unexpected. They did ask if I would give up involvement to take the job

title: Note Taker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Hayward, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: They are nor really asking questions. If you get a reference from any of your professors, you will be hired
Interview Questions: There is no surprise question.

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied through email to one of physics lab in University of Florida. Got contacted by PI, who asked me to send three reference letters. After a week or so, we talked over Skype for about an hr. After another week, he sent me invite to discuss the project in more detail, and gave a chance to do a quick seminar. After another 2 weeks or so, he sent me an offer.
Interview Questions: What were your favorite subjects to study when you were in middle and high school?

title: Research Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Worked as research assistant during graduate study and got hired directly after graduation
Interview Questions: Not very hard, do research, read papers and carry out experiments, give weekly project updates

title: Assistant Business Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: This was a transfer promotion from one department to another.  The interview was formal and the there where 5 people interviewing.  Very intense questioning.
Interview Questions: What would you do in a state of emergency with a full venue?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: You will have to contact the professor you are interested in. You may have to e-mail to the professor several times, with a few weeks interval as they tend to ignore or forget what you sent.
Interview Questions: Explain your research, what is your plan etc

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Long process. Started with a phone interview, then an in-person interview a few weeks later, hired a few weeks after that. Feedback was slow, but the interviews went smoothly and everyone was very kind and welcoming.
Interview Questions: Basic questions about work experience and customer service scenarios

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Florida (Merritt Island, FL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed on Skype. Very friendly interview. They provide you with visa sponsorship if needed. Process took about 3 months from start to finish. Applied in February started in July considering a long time for Visa approval and relocation from a different country.
Interview Questions: Just about the describing research interest and experience.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: It's completely by admission to the graduate program. Do well on Math Subject GRE.
Interview Questions: They watch you teach and you have to perform well.

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: I was hired throug hthe work study program and heard about the position through a friend. I have been employed by the school in the past so i was familiar with the hiring process and requirements for employment.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the hiring manager and two other secretaries.
Interview Questions: Tell us what your best qualities are.

title: Associate Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: A full day of interview including an hour long seminar.
Interview Questions: Nothing that stays in mind

title: Easy Interview Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process for the position of graduate assistant and the university of florida was not bad at all.  Interviewers were extremely polite and were also very helpful.  It was relaxed and was down in a positive environment. The interview was very easy and nothing to really ever worry about.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be good here?

title: IT Expert Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Advertise on the WEb site, apply according to the instruction or to direct hiring manager, Interview with 4 to 5 staff and manager plus the head of the department at the same time. May call for second interview.
Interview Questions: Field related, other behavior, team work,,,,etc

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: My interview here was very simple: I knew the PI I was interviewing and he basically offered me the job first thing in the interview.  Getting a job in academia can very much be a matter of network, and I had known the PI for 6 years already at that point.  It was more of a meeting to discern if I was interested followed by the formalities of paperwork
Interview Questions: If I was interested in the project and staying in FL after finishing my doctorate.

title: Post Doctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by supervisors, it was easy.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: IT Expert Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had one interview which lasted one and a half hours. The interviewer informed me that he would contact in a week either for another interview or to begin the job. He never did contact me and I attempt several times through both phone calls and email to reach him. I once spoke with a colleague of his and this man informed me that the hiring person was in a meeting with the board of directors about the job. I never heard back again from the University of Florida Engineering Department IT staff.
Interview Questions: Most difficult question was what encryption device do I most likely like to use... Bench Mark was the device that the University uses most.

title: IT Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process it mostly just to see if the team likes you.  You are pre-selcted with the jobs.ufl.edu website and given to the hiring manager.  Occasionally during interviews, one or more of the interviewing team will ask tech questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: There is a group interview where you do group activities so that they see how you work with others and then two one on one interviews with both current resident assistants and graduate hall directors.  This is helpful because some people shine in group settings and some shine in individual settings so you get to show the best side of your personality regardless.
Interview Questions: Tell me about an experience where you experienced working in a diverse group.

title: Clinic Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: online application, called within a week, group interview...very standard
Interview Questions: Very standard

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: I did not have to interview for my position so I can't speak to the process. The hiring process was full of delays, taking about 3 weeks to complete, most of it after I had already started working. So overall, my experiences were mixed with the hiring process. The people were helpful but the administration of the process was over-long.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Group Fitness Instructor/Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: After sending in resume/cover letter was called in for a panel interview. The panel interview was a bit nerve-wracking in front of the whole group fitness team of supervisors.
Interview Questions: What was one time you had to stand up for something you believe in?

title: IT Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job the previous year, I got a phone interview asking me technical questions. For example, how experience I am with computer software such as word doc, excel, adobe etc.
Interview Questions: There was no difficult question. It was pretty easy

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: After submitting both an online and paper application I was contacted to interview in the library. I was interviewed by my eventual direct supervisor/boss and one of the other full-time staff members. The interview was very basic, asking simple questions about my resume and my ability to work. Basically, if you submit your applications early and your availability hours mesh well with the returning workers, you're hired as long as you seem competent.
Interview Questions: When can you work?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Found an advisor. Applied to an NSF-IGERT fellowship. Applied to the department of my choice. Made appointments and met all of the professors involved in the NSF-IGERT, as well as the head of the department. I suppose that all of this made up for the interview process, as I did not interview formally for the position.
Interview Questions: Mostly just talked about my research interests. Very informal and non-intimidating.

title: Post Doctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I submitted my resume by an email, and then there were a couple of skype and email exchanges.
After that, professor asked me an on-site interview. 
He just asked some general questions. 
there was nothing much special.
Interview Questions:
they just ask some general questins. 
nothing much special.
Nothing much difficult.

title: Operations At the O'Connell Center Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straightforward. Applied online and then got called for an interview on campus. Got interviewed by two supervisors at the same. Behavioral interview looking at your leadership skills. Provide information of your participation in school organizations. Talk about how you work in your team projects.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you a team member was not cooperating.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Jacksonville, FL) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: First I participated in a phone interview that took about 15-20 minutes. I then came to interview in person - another short 15 minute interview. It was a one-on-one interview and I was not introduced to any other people in the office. I was offered the job within 24 hours of my in-person interview. The onboarding processes was more difficult than the interviewing process and I had to get things notarized and run all over town to get the new employee paperwork complete.
Interview Questions: None of the questions were memorable

title: Peer Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: There was three rounds of interviews, make sure to know everything about what you can offer as a resource to first year of florida students
Interview Questions: What was your biggest challenge in life and how did you overcome it?

title: BIM Expert Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for this part time position in the mid March, by the time I got a call for an interview in late May I had forgotten I'd even applied. This is to say the hiring process is long and drawn out. I came in for the interview and since this was a program specific job they asked me a few questions about using Revit. I brought my portfolio and work samples on my on fruition which is what got me the job. They waited another week before calling to confirm I got the job. It was another 2 weeks before I was in the system and approved to start work. 

All in all, it was a very drawn out process and even more so because it was just part time.
Interview Questions: They asked what I thought were some limitations in the Revit software

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty easy, you can talk to professor to see what are their areas of interested to see if they align with yours and you can as to work on their projects
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Bological Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions: I got this job through a friend's recommendation.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to handle mice?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had sent him a mail. He called me , had a short discussion with me and then walked me through the entire work and hired me.
Interview Questions: nothing as such

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Initially after getting shortlisted, I was asked to give an online test for a simple logic based program. After the test which was time critical, manager asked me for the interview time and requested me to bring code samples.
Interview Questions: most questions were based on experience and what best practices did I follow,

title: OPS Secretarial/Clerical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was stressful and I think unfair. Given a test on the computer and not able to search for any information. You were stress and wrong answers counted against you.
Interview Questions: Reading and Writing and testing on Excel and Word Documents and Grammar for a Receptionist Position.

title: Technology Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and they had me interview with three supervisors, wasn't a very long interview, they asked me about my technical experience as well, how much I knew about computers, etc
Interview Questions: Asked me to describe a tough customer service situation and how I dealt with it

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Group activities of varying topic and difficulty, followed by 2 individual interviews (2 on 1) with current RAs, professional staff, and graduate staff. A few weeks later an interview is sent out regarding the status of the application. Generally, applicants are sent into the "pool" to be considered at a later time but cannot be hired then and there, however exceptional applicants may be placed immediately.
Interview Questions: What makes a good Resident Assistant?

title: Biological Science Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Fort Pierce, FL) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was hired during my internship. The PhD will recommend you to the UF cooperator for hire. The max pay is 13 an hour.
Interview Questions: There was no formal interview. Hire was based on previous work.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was a three step process. There was an online application, a group interview/activities, and then two individual interviews. The online application made sure you were qualified for the position, the group portion was so that current staff could evaluate how you worked on a team, and the individual interviews to see how you would handle situations as an RA.
Interview Questions: How would you take control during a crisis?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Very professional--international job posting, followed by submission of credentials and assessment by interdisciplinary committee, 3-day interview (provided travel, lodging, dining, opportunities to meet key campus and college actors), fluid e-mail, phone and mail communication.
Interview Questions: None really, in my case.

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: none, I just had to have the requirements and research experience
Interview Questions: I didnt have an interview.

title: Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I got the job based on previous customer service experience.
Interview Questions: It was a laid-back experience because they were in the need of someone and I was looking for a job. One tip I'd give is make sure you have previous experience or you can get the job (if there's an opening) through a friend who's already a DA.

title: Training Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initital communication was inviting and respectful.  One interview with presentation requested and completed.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 10 months. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed through skype as I was an international student. The duration was almost 2 hours. My future mentor met me on skype asked details about what got me interested in her lab research, what kind of research work would I prefer, what is the kind of research that I have been exposed to etc.
Interview Questions: What got you interested in the kind of research done in our lab?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very informal. I was interviewed over the phone. The lab that I applied to was doing fMRI and needed me to know programming, shell scripting, MATLAB etc.  and I said yes. I got job offered over the phone itself
Interview Questions: They were doing fMRI and wanted me to know programming, shell scripting, MATLAB. I was asked if I knew these.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to join the interview 2 weeks after I submitted the application. Interview was conducted by three supervisors in a small room.
Interview Questions: How do you overcome your most difficult situation and how this help you in your career path

title: Web Designer & Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I began the process by completing an application online with my work experience, education, and skills. I got called in for an interview about 1 to 1 and half months later. I got the since that they had narrowed the job down to a short list (about 3 candidates). I interviewed with the entire office (a small group of 5 people). The questions were not technically specific but where more designed to understand how I would fit into their work group, if I would be a cultural fit. I could tell that there was one among them who understood some of the concepts I talked about and others were not aware of the typical web process. I was pleased to see a lot of ah-ha faces.
Interview Questions: I think the most difficult part of the interview was trying to understand the organization's structure and where the work group I would be working with fit in. There were a lot of acronyms I had to ask for clarification about, even the mission of the work groups was not entirely clear.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the managers/directors of the unit I was interviewing for, rather than an HR rep.  Unfortunately, these people did not have much experience interviewing employees but we pleasant at least.
Interview Questions: I was being interviewed to take an hourly position but was asked if I would be willing to work after hours, on my own time, to learn more about the unit.  This type of question would be appropriate for a higher-level, salaried employee but not for an hourly employee.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Asked very typical interview questions. I enjoyed the interview and the chance to meet new people and make new connections. The interviewers had a lot of passion for their work and were very excited to share that passion with me. I would love to work at the University of Florida.
Interview Questions: What is your worst trait?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied through job.ufl.edu. got a call back within 2 weeks. Was asked basic lab techniques.
Interview Questions: If you ever had to alter anything in a lab procedure what was it and why.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: My sponsor in the PhD program interviewed me and referred me to the Dean as a teaching assistant. I was known to the department and had guest lectured at the University by invitation in my professional capacity.  My educational background was more diverse than the normal incoming student and I am more professionally experienced and these qualities made my range of teaching assignments wider.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience in educational settings including public communications positions.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview as such. It was required to submit statement of purpose and letters of recommendation from 3 sources which I had picked as my undergraduate professors. The application packet was then reviewed by professors who assessed your potential for research and recommended you for admission to the central admission office
Interview Questions: The most difficult question to be submitted online was how is your community under represented in higher education.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview with the major professor. He was mainly interested in my previous research experience and what classes I had already taken. He wanted to know what my future goal were as a research scientist.
Interview Questions: What type of research do you have experience in?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: introduce your background; your work experience as a web developer
Interview Questions: what's OO? Main features?

title: Experiential Education Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was great—both the graduate assistant and my direct supervisor who interviewed me were pleasant and very informative. The two interviewers were fairly casual and interviewed me in one of the offices. I was told what I could anticipate on the job (all of this turned out to be quite accurate), and they asked me questions about my previous work experience and how I would apply experience and education to this job.
Interview Questions: The most important question was how I planned to balance school and work loads

title: Math TA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: apply online, submit gpa, gre, math gre and 3 letters of rec.  I'm not sure if it's any more difficult than other schools on the same level since I was accepted at most of the similar places I applied.   They gave me an answer fairly quickly however which was quite nice.
Interview Questions: It was more of an apply and get rejected or not.

title: Gradauate Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Raleigh, NC) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: My major professor called in after the department recruitment committee short-listed my candidature for the doctorate program. Our conversation was then based on my expectations of the doctoral program, my previous research experience and my ability to learn new concepts including areas of interest and scope of the lab I was going to join.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to spend your time at UF applying engineering and chemistry concepts in synthesizing new materials?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: 2 in-person interviews with 2 PIs and other research coordinators.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 4 years? (they are looking for someone long-term)

title: Envoy Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Miami, FL) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: We met multiple times in person, several days of meeting with new people, then finally, a round-table discussion. Afterwards, we determined whether or not we were a fit for each other needs in a one-on-one situation.
Interview Questions: Can you please share relative experience in terms of special admission envoy situations?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: You should submit a application the university,then the professors and staff there will evaluate you materials. You will receive an offer if they think you are qualified. The overall requirement of UF is median, not too difficult. Also, you may contact with the professor asking if there is opening RA positions.
Interview Questions: GRE, Tofel

title: IT Expert Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview really depends on the interviewing members, typically technical level is fairly straight forward with specifics about the programming language experience. It really depends on the position and hiring manager, they typically do not have a script or coding tests, it is more of a conversation type of interview.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with this language, that language, this framework?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Email Interview. GRE, TOEFL, Degree Transcripts were reviewed. Had t prepare a statement of purpose. Fill in the application to grad school as well as financial assistance form. Had to contact principal investigators with matching interests. The principal investigator need to have grant funding to support graduate student. The visa processing and logistics had to be dealt with.
Interview Questions: My research interests.

title: General Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relatively easy. They asked fairly simple questions like past experience, aspirations with the company and what I have to offer. The important thing is to be certain that you are prepared in advance and are knowledgeable about both the position you are applying for and your past experience.
Interview Questions: What was your greatest accomplishment?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Apply directly to Ph.D student then request approval for faculty, Its also important to know how much the research grant is to know how long the project will last. It is also possible, that these grants can be very short. Interview process is really about personality and excel skills.
Interview Questions: What was my experience with excel

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Group interview and then individual interview with two RAs
Interview Questions: A difficult situation you had to deal with.Strengths and Weaknesses

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: It is basically a introduction of that company and ask me some questions about the experience that I had during my undergraduate study career. what's are they looking for. title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Lake Alfred, FL) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Hiring and interview process was carried out professionally, at very good level of distinction. Professional scientists representing two different fields of expertise were participating. Nearly 100% of questions were related to details within profession they were about. Sufficient time was given to prepare and submit an answer. The atmosphere was quite friendly, overall.
Interview Questions: Particular imaginary situation was suggested, difficult both from psychological and professional standpoint. Few possible scenarios were offered. none of them seemed to be easy to go.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions:
I was recruited for one of their new programs, and asked to send my transcripts and test scores. I was given a short phone interview later on, and then flown in to have a series of interviews with many different faculty and admissions committee throughout a 24 hour period. 

2 days later, I got an email with an offer.
Interview Questions: More than the questions, the most difficult part was that the most important interview (with the director of the Genetics institute, director of the program, and head of the admissions committee) was reserved as the last interview of the day, after 12 or so other interviews with other faculty. I was exhausted.

title: Resident Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: It is an all day interview process. You will do a lot of team activities and seeing how you work in groups and crisis. There will be a lot of ice breakers to show off your personality. They will end the day with a one-on-one interview with a supervisor and a current RA.  It isn't anything too difficult, just show why you truly want the job.
Interview Questions: Look up the housing mission statement. It will be very helpful when being asked questions.

title: Engineering Interview

Interview Questions: do you know your job responsibility?

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Apr 2009

title: Web Developer Interview

Bonus points for your perceptions of the people, office, and work culture"

Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2008

title: Graduate Student Interview

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Florida

title: Security Guard Interview

Interview Descriptions: The interview process for the student assistant position at the University of Florida in Gainesville, Florida was okay - it was not bad at all and did not take a very long time.

what grants you will be applying to when you get here?

title: Graphic Designer II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida
Interview Descriptions:
Two rounds of group Zoom interviews and a 1-on-1 with the Dean of that department. Interviews went fine, everyone was friendly enough. Asked pretty generic questions about my experience; nothing too crazy. 

What was upsetting was that I was offered the position, which I accepted, and was told the salary was negotiable. When I attempted to counter offer with a very reasonable salary bump, I was told the offer was rescinded. I was pretty shocked so I reached out and apologized for misunderstanding and they emailed back to say it had nothing to do with my counter offer. It was super shady and seemed sneaky and really put me off on UF as an employer. I'm still receiving random emails months later saying that they are "going with another applicant".
Interview Questions: They did seem to be concerned that I was going to dislike the "older" environment of the college?

title: Data Analyst Interview

Introduce your self.
Database related questions
