Interview Descriptions: The interview process was great—both the graduate assistant and my direct supervisor who interviewed me were pleasant and very informative. The two interviewers were fairly casual and interviewed me in one of the offices. I was told what I could anticipate on the job (all of this turned out to be quite accurate), and they asked me questions about my previous work experience and how I would apply experience and education to this job.
Interview Questions: The most important question was how I planned to balance school and work loads

title: Math TA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: apply online, submit gpa, gre, math gre and 3 letters of rec.  I'm not sure if it's any more difficult than other schools on the same level since I was accepted at most of the similar places I applied.   They gave me an answer fairly quickly however which was quite nice.
Interview Questions: It was more of an apply and get rejected or not.

title: Gradauate Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Raleigh, NC) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: My major professor called in after the department recruitment committee short-listed my candidature for the doctorate program. Our conversation was then based on my expectations of the doctoral program, my previous research experience and my ability to learn new concepts including areas of interest and scope of the lab I was going to join.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to spend your time at UF applying engineering and chemistry concepts in synthesizing new materials?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: 2 in-person interviews with 2 PIs and other research coordinators.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 4 years? (they are looking for someone long-term)

title: Envoy Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Miami, FL) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: We met multiple times in person, several days of meeting with new people, then finally, a round-table discussion. Afterwards, we determined whether or not we were a fit for each other needs in a one-on-one situation.
Interview Questions: Can you please share relative experience in terms of special admission envoy situations?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: You should submit a application the university,then the professors and staff there will evaluate you materials. You will receive an offer if they think you are qualified. The overall requirement of UF is median, not too difficult. Also, you may contact with the professor asking if there is opening RA positions.
Interview Questions: GRE, Tofel

title: IT Expert Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview really depends on the interviewing members, typically technical level is fairly straight forward with specifics about the programming language experience. It really depends on the position and hiring manager, they typically do not have a script or coding tests, it is more of a conversation type of interview.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with this language, that language, this framework?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Email Interview. GRE, TOEFL, Degree Transcripts were reviewed. Had t prepare a statement of purpose. Fill in the application to grad school as well as financial assistance form. Had to contact principal investigators with matching interests. The principal investigator need to have grant funding to support graduate student. The visa processing and logistics had to be dealt with.
Interview Questions: My research interests.

title: General Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relatively easy. They asked fairly simple questions like past experience, aspirations with the company and what I have to offer. The important thing is to be certain that you are prepared in advance and are knowledgeable about both the position you are applying for and your past experience.
Interview Questions: What was your greatest accomplishment?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Apply directly to Ph.D student then request approval for faculty, Its also important to know how much the research grant is to know how long the project will last. It is also possible, that these grants can be very short. Interview process is really about personality and excel skills.
Interview Questions: What was my experience with excel

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Group interview and then individual interview with two RAs
Interview Questions: A difficult situation you had to deal with.Strengths and Weaknesses

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: It is basically a introduction of that company and ask me some questions about the experience that I had during my undergraduate study career. what's are they looking for. And what kind of qualities are they expecting. In engineering, they need a strong problem-solving skill and team working spirit.
Interview Questions: find a missing data in 100 sorted numbers using least times

title: ESL Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very easy, simply talking with the director. The interview was about teaching style, some perspectives of ESL education.
Interview Questions: What type of teacher can you be described as?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Lake Alfred, FL) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Hiring and interview process was carried out professionally, at very good level of distinction. Professional scientists representing two different fields of expertise were participating. Nearly 100% of questions were related to details within profession they were about. Sufficient time was given to prepare and submit an answer. The atmosphere was quite friendly, overall.
Interview Questions: Particular imaginary situation was suggested, difficult both from psychological and professional standpoint. Few possible scenarios were offered. none of them seemed to be easy to go.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions:
I was recruited for one of their new programs, and asked to send my transcripts and test scores. I was given a short phone interview later on, and then flown in to have a series of interviews with many different faculty and admissions committee throughout a 24 hour period. 

2 days later, I got an email with an offer.
Interview Questions: More than the questions, the most difficult part was that the most important interview (with the director of the Genetics institute, director of the program, and head of the admissions committee) was reserved as the last interview of the day, after 12 or so other interviews with other faculty. I was exhausted.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: It is an all day interview process. You will do a lot of team activities and seeing how you work in groups and crisis. There will be a lot of ice breakers to show off your personality. They will end the day with a one-on-one interview with a supervisor and a current RA.  It isn't anything too difficult, just show why you truly want the job.
Interview Questions: Look up the housing mission statement. It will be very helpful when being asked questions.

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: setup an time for phone interview. and asked several questions, talked about the responsibility of my job
Interview Questions: do you know your job responsibility?

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very smooth. They described very well what do they expect out of the job and they explained the salary and all the other benefits.
Interview Questions: The interview was more of a discussion rather than a question and answer.

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: Consisted of 1/2 hr interview , where i was asked questions related to java, my previous work experince in the university
Interview Questions: Questons about my research work at the university

title: Advertising Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: I don't really needed an Interview.  I submitted the application and then they made the dicision. "Please be as detailed as possible - everything from your initial communications with the company, organization and planning of the interview, number and type of interviews, and any advice you might offer to other interview candidates. Bonus points for your perceptions of the people, office, and work culture"
Interview Questions: What is your career goal

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to go into the office of the head of the research group. We talked together about my goals and expectations and his expectations of me. We also discuss potential research projects and where my interests lie.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: It is the regular recruiting process for graduate students (nothing special). After exchanging emails with my future adviser, I finally met him in person. We had a meeting of about one hour. Then, he hired me as research scholar. Later on I became officially a graduate student of the department.
Interview Questions: Where do you want to be five years from now?
